block.p: Diana Yvette Perales, the daughter of Gladys Pena and Cesar Perales, both of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Zachary Chang Buck, the son of Susan Hum, also of Brooklyn, and Dean Buck of Philadelphia. The Rev. Arthur Leone performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Good Counsel Roman Catholic Church in Manhattan.

Ms. Perales, who is keeping her name, is a medical social worker for the Visiting Nurse Service of New York. She graduated from the University of Hartford and received a master's degree in social work from Fordham. Mr. Buck graduated from the State University at Stony Brook, N.Y., and is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at New York University. The bride and bridegroom, both 28, are also partners in Tinyteapot.com, which sells tea over the Internet.

Diana Yvette Perales, the daughter of Gladys Pena and Cesar Perales, both of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Zachary Chang Buck, the son of Susan Hum, also of Brooklyn, and Dean Buck of Philadelphia. The Rev. Arthur Leone performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Good Counsel Roman Catholic Church in Manhattan.

Ms. Perales, who is keeping her name, is a medical social worker for the Visiting Nurse Service of New York. She graduated from the University of Hartford and received a master's degree in social work from Fordham. Mr. Buck graduated from the State University at Stony Brook, N.Y., and is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at New York University. The bride and bridegroom, both 28, are also partners in Tinyteapot.com, which sells tea over the Internet.

The bride's father, a former deputy mayor for health and human services under Mayor David N. Dinkins, was the senior vice president for government relations at New York-Presbyterian Hospital until April and now works in Brooklyn as a private consultant on human services. The bride's mother is the director and curator of the Raices Museum and Archives, an organization in New York, which is developing a museum to preserve salsa and other Afro-Caribbean music.

The bridegroom's father recently retired as a corporate sales representative in Philadelphia for McGraw-Hill Publishing. The bridegroom's mother is the costume designer for ''The Late Show With David Letterman'' in Manhattan.
